text: Hawkeye is the name of two fictional superheroes created by Marvel Comics. The first Hawkeye's real name is Clint Barton and the second Hawkeye's real name is Kate Bishop. Clint Barton was created by writer Stan Lee and artist Don Heck, the character first appeared as a supervillain in Tales of Suspense #57 (September 1964), while Kate Bishop was created by writer Allan Heinberg and artist Jim Cheung, and first appeared in Young Avengers #1 (April 2005). == Clint Barton's fictional background == === Biography === He is a former circus worker and criminal-turned-hero, who received his archery skills as a young boy through training with Swordsman and Trickshot. Barton had eventually joined both the East Coast and West Coast branches of the Avengers, even leading at one time. Aliases Ronin, Goliath II, Golden Archer, the Marksman, Father Time, Longbow Nicknames Clint Place of birth Waverly, Iowa First appearance Tales of Suspense #57 (September, 1964) Publisher Marvel Comics Alignment Real Name good Clinton Francis "Clint" Barton === Work === Occupation Adventurer Base - === Relations === Relatives Harold Barton (father, deceased), Edith Barton (mother, deceased), Bernard Barton (brother, deceased), Barbara Morse (wife, deceased) Group Affiliation Avengers, Thunderbolts, Avengers West Coast, Great Lakes Avengers, Shadows, Chain Gang, former partner of the Black Widow Friends - Enemies - === Powers === None. As Goliath, Barton used gases designed by Hank Pym to grow to great heights, with appropriate increases in strength and toughness. (He could also use them to shrink to minuscule size). === Abilities === Ronin is a world-class archer and marksman. His above average reflexes and hand-eye-coordination make him the most proficient archer ever known. He is also trained to throw knifes, darts, balls, bolas and boomerangs. He is natural athlete. He is also formidable unarmed combatant, thanks largelymore. == Kate Bishop's fictional background == === Biography === She was a regular civilian, with considerable archery skills, who happened to cross paths with the Young Avengers on a mission, eventually inviting herself onto the team. She became Barton's protégé and they both operates under Hawkeye name simultaneously. Aliases Hawkeye, Hawkette, Lady Hawkeye, Lady Hawkguy Nicknames Kate Place of birth New York City, New York First Appearance Young Avengers #1 (April 2005) Publisher Marvel Comics Alignment Real Name good Katherine Elizabeth Kate Bishop === Appearance === Gender female Race Human Height 5’5 // 165.1 cm Weight 120 lbs // 54 kg Eye color Blue Hair color Black === Work === Occupation Adventurer Base - === Relations === Relatives Derek Bishop (father), Eleanor Bishop (mother, deceased), Susan Bishop (sister) Group Affiliation Avengers, Young Avengers, Champions, West Coast Avengers, Secret Avengers Friends Ramone and Johnny Watts, Quincy “Quinn” Bradford III, and Mikka Nguyen. Kate also has custody of Clint’s and now her beloved dog, Lucky. Enemies - === Powers === None. Kate is a highly skilled at archery, fencing, swordmanship, jujitsu, gymnastics, boxing, and other forms of combat. === Abilitites === She carries two battle staves similar to those once used by Mockingbird, a sword similar to the Swordsman's, as well as Clint Barton's bow and arrows. Black Panther has also supplied her with trick arrows. == In other media == The character has been adapted to different forms of media, including television series, action figures, and video games. In the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) franchise, Hawkeye is portrayed both by Jeremy Renner and Hailee Steinfeld.
